metadata.title: CVE-2023-52600 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix uaf in jfs_evict_inode When the execution of diMount(ipimap) fails, theobject ipimap that has been released may be accessed in diFreeSpecial().Asynchronous ipimap release occurs when rcu_core() calls jfs_free_node().Therefore, when diMount(ipimap) fails, sbi->ipimap should not beinitialized as ipimap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-177-generic - 5.4.0-177.197
linux-image-5.4.0-177-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-177.197
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-177-generic - 5.4.0-177.197
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-177-lowlatency - 5.4.0-177.197
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-105-generic - 5.15.0-105.115~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-105-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-105.115~20.04.1
